sentences.english: Taken away by a human being means that a Bhikkhu lives, mingling improperly with laity.
sentences.chinese: 被人所取是指比丘不如法地跟俗人混在一起。

sentences.english: To be neither fish, nor flesh, nor fowl
sentences.chinese: 食鱼肉的话是僧，只吃肉的是俗人。

sentences.english: Think with the wise, but talk with the vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 同智者一起考虑，与俗人一起交谈。

sentences.english: I am a vulgar person, the skeleton used to dissolute , can't change also don't want to change.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个俗人，形骸放浪惯了，改不了也不想改。

sentences.english: Only a vulgarian talks ceaselesslly about how much this or that cost him.
sentences.chinese: 只有俗人说如何能减轻那些成本的价值。

sentences.english: This is what sravakas cannot do.
sentences.chinese: 这就是俗人所做不到的？

sentences.english: The new proposals affect both clergy and laity.
sentences.chinese: 新的建议与神职人员和俗人都有关系。

sentences.english: I am clearer know, it is for the most part common laic.
sentences.chinese: 我更清楚的知道，大部分都是普通的俗人。

sentences.english: To some extent this pattern was extended to the laity as well.
sentences.chinese: 在一定程度上这种模式扩大到俗人的。

sentences.english: He said the microblogging site and similar services were “poor man’s email systems”.
sentences.chinese: 他说微博站点及类似服务是“俗人的邮件系统”。

sentences.english: The professor set out to study the customs of the natives.
sentences.chinese: 教授着手研究当地居民的风俗人情。

sentences.english: Opus Dei urges priests and laypeople to strenuously pursue sanctification through everyday discipline.
sentences.chinese: 它要求牧师及俗人通过日常的规矩来努力追求圣化。

sentences.english: Advertising reflects the mores of society, but it does not influence them.
sentences.chinese: 广告反映社会的风俗人情，却不能影响它们。

sentences.english: To tell the laity our love.
sentences.chinese: 如果向俗人把我们的爱情倾诉。

sentences.english: Sometimes, not always, the clergy and laity voted in separate chambers.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，并非总是，神职人员和俗人投了单独的分庭。

sentences.english: Ordinary beings are many; noble and humane beings are few.
sentences.chinese: 一般的俗人最多，高尚的仁人很少。

definition: to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
